sections.heading: of taxes; receipts; how numbered
sections.text: All receipts issued by the county treasurer for taxes paid to him or her shall be numbered consecutively.SourceLaws 1903, c. 73, § 149, p. 442;R.S.1913, § 6478;C.S.1922, § 6001;C.S.1929, § 77-1906;Laws 1943, c. 174, § 1(1), p. 607;R.S.1943, § 77-1706;Laws 1945, c. 18

77-1706.Collection of taxes; receipts; how numbered.

All receipts issued by the county treasurer for taxes paid to him or her shall be numbered consecutively.

SourceLaws 1903, c. 73, § 149, p. 442;R.S.1913, § 6478;C.S.1922, § 6001;C.S.1929, § 77-1906;Laws 1943, c. 174, § 1(1), p. 607;R.S.1943, § 77-1706;Laws 1945, c. 189, § 6, p. 589;Laws 1993, LB 346, § 19;Laws 1997, LB 269, § 53;Laws 1997, LB 270, § 99;Laws 2003, LB 292, § 13;Laws 2012, LB851, § 3.

Annotations

Tax receipt alone is not sufficient to establish fact of levy or assessment. Adams v. Osgood, 55 Neb. 766, 76 N.W. 446 (1898).
